feed.title: SAP Community - SAP HANA Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP HANA Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Deployed CAP+Fiori App is running, but UI gives 404 on metadata call and is not visible in Work Zone
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm developing a full-stack application in SAP Business Application Studio and I'm facing a final issue after a seemingly successful deployment to Cloud Foundry.

My Project Setup:

  • Backend: SAP CAP with Node.js

  • Database: SAP HANA Cloud, using synonyms to access tables from another container.

  • Frontend: SAP Fiori Elements (List Report Object Page template).

  • Security: Using a standard XSUAA service.

  • Deployment Target: The final goal is to integrate the app into our SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

The Problem / Observed Behavior: The deployment to Cloud Foundry using cf deploy completes 100% successfully. In the CF space, I can see that my applications (-srv, -ui) are in the "Started" state, and the -db-deployer is "Stopped", which is the expected behavior.

The issue is that the application is unreachable and invisible to end-users:

  1. When I access the direct URL of the CAP backend service (...-srv.cfapps...), I correctly see the CAP welcome page listing my service endpoint at /odata/v4/catalog. This confirms the backend is alive and serving the correct path.

  2. However, when I access the main UI application URL (...-ui.cfapps...), the page title loads, but the rest of the page is blank.

  3. Checking the browser's developer console, I see a 404 (Not Found) error when the application tries to fetch the service metadata. The failing request is: GET .../odata/v4/catalog/$metadata.

  4. Consequently, the application does not appear in the Content Explorer of the SAP Build Work Zone after refreshing the "HTML5 Apps" content provider.

My Question: What could be the reason for the 404 Not Found error during the metadata call from the UI, given that the deployment is successful and the backend service is confirmed to be running and serving the correct path? It seems there is a routing or communication issue between the AppRouter (-ui app) and the CAP service (-srv app) that I am unable to diagnose further.

Relevant Configuration Files attached

entry.title: Viewing Tax at Line-Item Level for Generic Expense Materials
entry.content: It is possible to view the tax amounts directly at the line-item level during the goods receipt process. This setup does not rely on Purchase Info Records (PIRs) and is configured to work with generic expense materials, ensuring that tax information is visible and processed correctly for all relevant transactions

entry.title: Issue with several fields referencing the same object in a HANA Star Join
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am struggling with making a HANA Calculation view in HANA Cloud (built using the HANA Artefact tools in Business Application Studio), where my information cube includes a reference to the same dimension in several columns. The simplified example is as follows:

A table of Business Partners consisting of ID and Name. For this I have made a Dimension view named "BusinessPartner" consisting of a "Business Partner ID" and "Business Partner Name" column.

A table of Sales Orders consisting of ID, SellerID and BuyerID, the latter both being references to a record in the Business Partner table. For this I have made a Cube view.

Lastly, I want to add the "BusinessPartner" dimension to the Start Schema at the top. Once as "Seller" and once as "Buyer". This is the seemingly trivial scenario I am not able to accomplish. I am running into the following challenges

  • I cannot bring the same Dimension view into the Cube more than once (which I can overcome by creating synonyms)
  • Regardless of me changing the Label Aliases, the dimension still comes out as "Business Partner" (I need it to be "Seller" and "Buyer").

The only way I have so far been able to get the desired end result (the "Seller" and "Buyer" dimensions showing to the end user in Analytics Cloud) is to create a Dimension View for each purpose the referenced object has (i.e. no generic "BusinessPartner" dimension but instead one "Seller" dimension and one "Buyer" dimension). While I am getting the right end result that way, it becomes a nightmare to build and maintain all those dimension views where the only difference is their labels.

I hope the issue is clearly described and that somebody can put me on the right track. Thanks!

//Carl

entry.title: Request for Actual Cost Report on Existing WBS Elements
entry.content:
Hello,

We would like to request assistance regarding the Actual Report for the existing WBS elements in the system. We have searched for a standard report that would allow us to extract this information but were unable to find one.  I would like to provide additional information regarding what we would like to see in the system:

The structure is based on the S_ALR_87013542 T-code. This report, following a drill-down logic, presents actual values for revenue, COGS, and investments on a location basis. At the same time, it also allows us to view individual detailed data for the specific GL accounts we require. I attached a new attachment. We want to get this kind of a report on Public Cloud S4HANA system.

Could you please advise if such a report exists, or provide guidance on how we can retrieve it?  

Best Regards

entry.title: Importing Remote Tables to SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I've set up a SAP HANA (Cloud) connection within Datasphere in order to import remote tables. The connection is valid, Data flows are enabled, Replication flows are enabled and Remote tables are enabled.

I am able to access the schemas, import the remote tables from my HANA data base and I see all the right columns within the Data Builder. When I want to view the data in the Data Viewer I get the message 'No data' in all my imported remote tables, even though there is data available in the respective source system (HANA).

I've attached a screenshot of the message for reference.

Does anyone have a clue what the issue around this might be?

Best,

Kaleab

entry.title: Manifest file does not exist for SAP HANA Cloud Knowledge Graph Engine (Triple Store)
entry.content:
Hello Dear Gurus,

 

I am currently doing the tutorial group Get Started with the SAP HANA Database Explorer,  particularly because I want to try out the SAP HANA Cloud Knowledge Graph Engine. Therefore, I completed the first 3 tutorials in the group as per requirement and started with the tutorial which is of actual interest to me: Try Out Multi-Model Functionality with the SAP HANA Database Explorer and Database Objects App. 

Following the tutorial, I updated my HANA instance, increased memory and storage, updated to the latest version and of course activated the Triple Store feature.

Just as it gets interesting, I get an error which I am not able to understand and fix. When I try following query from the tutorial which creates a Knowledge Graph in the tutorial database:

--CALL SPARQL_EXECUTE('DROP GRAPH <kg_hotels>', '', ?, ?);
CALL SPARQL_EXECUTE('
    INSERT DATA { GRAPH <kg_hotels> { 
        <http://example.org/hotels/Delta> a <Hotel>;
        <name> "Delta";
        <city> "Waterloo";
        <yearBuilt> 2012 .

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/IndoorPool1> a <IndoorPool>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Delta>;
        <length> 25;
        <width> 10.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Hottub1> a <Hottub>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Delta>;
        <length> 6;
        <width> 6.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/FitnessCenter1> a <FitnessCenter>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Delta>.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Keurig> a <CoffeeMaker>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Delta>. 

        <http://example.org/hotels/Sunshine> a <Hotel>;
        <name> "Sunshine";
        <city> "Clearwater";
        <yearBuilt> 1975 .

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Restaurant1> a <Restaurant>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Sunshine>;
        <seating> 95.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/FitnessCenter2> a <FitnessCenter>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Sunshine>.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Laundry1> a <DryCleaning>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Sunshine>. 

        <http://example.org/hotels/Congress> a <Hotel>;
        <name> "Congress";
        <city> "Seattle";
        <yearBuilt> 2012 .

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/IndoorPool2> a <IndoorPool>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Congress>;
        <length> 30;
        <width> 15.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Restaurant2> a <Restaurant>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Congress>;
        <seating> 122.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/FitnessCenter3> a <FitnessCenter>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Congress>.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Spa1> a <Spa>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/Congress>. 

        <http://example.org/hotels/OceanStar> a <Hotel>;
        <name> "Ocean Star";
        <city> "Atlantic City";
        <yearBuilt> 2012 .

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/IndoorPool3> a <IndoorPool>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/OceanStar>;
        <length> 50;
        <width> 30.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Restaurant2> a <Restaurant>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/OceanStar>;
        <seating> 205.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Cleaning1> a <CleaningServices>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/OceanStar>.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Spa2> a <Spa>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/OceanStar>. 

        <http://example.org/hotels/LongIsland> a <Hotel>;
        <name> "LongIsland";
        <city> "Long Island";
        <yearBuilt> 2021 .

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Entertainment1> a <Entertainment>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/LongIsland>.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Restaurant3> a <Restaurant>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/LongIsland>;
        <seating> 122.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Cleaning2> a <CleaningServices>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/LongIsland>.

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Spa3> a <Spa>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/LongIsland>. 

        <http://example.org/hotels/hotelamenities/Hottub2> a <Hottub>;
        <included_at> <http://example.org/hotels/LongIsland>. 
    } 
    }
    ', '', ?, ?
);

, I get following error:
Could not execute 'CALL SPARQL_EXECUTE(' INSERT DATA { GRAPH <kg_hotels> { ...'
Error: (dberror) [129]: transaction rolled back by an internal error: generic Error - check_ready_for_request: Startup error - Triple Store cannot handle request. exception 335110: generic. Error - /0/snap-4.5_1/manifest: Missing file - Manifest file does not exist

I get this error with any query that uses the Knowledge Graph Engine.

I figured it might be because the Triple Store feature wasn't activated properly. I manually restarted the HANA instance in addition to the default restart that occurs when the feature is activated. This made no difference in the behavior.

 

Does anyone understand this error or know how to resolve it? Can anyone help me with the issue? I would be immensely grateful! Thank you very much.

 

Kind regards
Joshua

entry.title: Use Hana Graph Engine with Springboot
entry.content:
I'm building a Spring Boot application and considering using the SAP HANA Graph engine as graph database. I'm wondering if there’s an ORM framework, like Spring Data Neo4j, that supports direct interaction with HANA Graph.

It appears that we can model vertex and edge tables using Spring JPA, but when it comes to GraphScript, we are limited to using stored procedures. That means I have to create the procedure on the HANA instance first and then call it from the service instead of using a native query with Spring JPA for DB interaction.

Is there a more direct way to use GraphScript within SpringBoot without predefining stored procedures in HANA?

entry.title: SAP S/4 Hana : Multiple API Call In One Transaction
entry.content:
Hi,

I’m developing a CAP application using Node.js. I’m consuming remote APIs from SAP S/4HANA Cloud (public edition)—for example, reading Business Partners and creating Sales Orders. At one point, I need to call multiple APIs to perform updates and deletions in sequence. What happens if one of these calls fails midway? How can I roll back everything I’ve done? Is there a good way to handle this?

Thanks.

entry.title: How to access the SAP HANA Cloud database behind a BTP ABAP Environment instance?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

we are currently working with the SAP BTP ABAP Environment and would like to better understand the technical access to the SAP HANA Cloud instance that runs behind it. We are aware that the underlying SAP HANA Cloud instance is managed by the SAP ABAP Environment, but we are unsure about the supported ways to access it or extend it with custom database artifacts.

We have two related questions:

1. Direct access to the database
Is it possible to connect directly to the SAP HANA Cloud instance behind the BTP ABAP Environment — for example via Database Explorer or any external SQL tool — in order to create or inspect custom SQL views or procedures?
We already tried to create a SAP HANA Cloud project in SAP Business Application Studio, but the setup failed with the message that no database instance is available, even though we know the ABAP Environment uses a managed HANA Cloud instance in the background.
If such access is possible, where can we find or retrieve the database credentials / connection details?

2. Access pattern for SaaS scenarios
We are planning to build SaaS solutions on top of the BTP ABAP Environment.
In our CAP-based SaaS applications, we can retrieve tenant-specific database (hdi container) credentials via the Service Manager.
Is there a similar mechanism available in the BTP ABAP Environment to programmatically access or manage database connections (hdi containers) for different tenants?

If direct access is currently not possible, is it planned or on the SAP roadmap to allow connecting to the managed HANA Cloud instance in the future?

Any guidance, documentation, or personal experience around this would be very much appreciated!

Maybe @FrankJentsch can also share some insights here, since you have been very active around BTP ABAP Environment topics in the past.

Thanks & kind regards
Johannes

entry.title: Replicate data from SAP BW into SAP HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

I have a challenge to get the data from BW into SAP HANA. 

Expectation is a real-time replication, which is later using in SAC as a chart. 

Now - we did create a BW Query. However, when I try to replciate the query, I get a error. The error happens when I try to start the replication. 

Appreciate your inputs on the following: 

1. Best way to get data from BW into HANA Cloud View

2. Is it feasible to use BW Query for this purpose

3. If BW data is stored in InfoObjects/DSO/Info Provider etc. - Is it feasible to replicate them directly into HANA. 

Regards,

Sharath
